New Records: Suryakumar Yadav scored 50 not out, contributing significantly to India's win.
Arshdeep Singh took four wickets, a career-best performance.
The match marked the end of the cricketing era at the New York stadium.
Key Match Events: Key dismissals included Virat Kohli early on and Jasdeep being run out late in the innings.
Suryakumar Yadav and Shivam Dube formed a crucial partnership to steer India to victory.
USA's competitive total of 110-8 wasn't enough to convert into a win.
Pre-Game Insights: USA was second in Group A with four points after the match.
The match was the last at the New York stadium, significant for the venue's history.
Post-Match Reflections: Players and the captain expressed relief and satisfaction with the win.
USA's next match against Ireland is crucial for their qualification chances.
India's qualification for the Super Eights was a milestone in their World Cup journey.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was a low-scoring thriller, typical of T20 cricket at the venue.
The end of the stadium's cricketing era added historical context to the match.
